[LEXICON]: Overly complex vocabulary in some passages (e.g., "luminous pearls", "drooping moustaches") may hinder smooth reading for some readers
[GRAMMAR]: Minor inconsistency in tense usage (noted in a few places but not pervasive)

[LOGIC]: Unexplained and unrelated narrative insertions (Diderot and Mr. Otis passages disrupt the main story)
[STRUCTURE]: Non-sequential memory recall (graduation day mention feels abrupt without prior context in this segment)
[TRANSITION]: Lack of clear transitions between some scenes (e.g., from jewel selection to memory flashback)

[SYNTAX]: Occasionally complex sentence structures may impede immediate clarity (e.g., "The utter futility of attempting to make East and West understand each other had stilled her lips...").
[LEXICON]: Some archaic or less common vocabulary might require a second read for full comprehension (e.g., "soothsayers", "cyclic animals", "black and yellow days").
